docs.snippet: To the Editor of The New York Times: In a letter to your newspaper publisted on Aug. 15, Pablo M. Ynsfran, Paraguayan Charge d Affaires, undertook to inform the American public upon certain juridical points in connection with the Chaco dispute. Such...
docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor of The New York Times: In a letter to your newspaper publisted on Aug. 15, Pablo M. Ynsfran, Paraguayan Charge d Affaires, undertook to inform the American public upon certain juridical points in connection with the Chaco dispute. Such a procedure invariably leads to misunderstanding of the problem by the public.

headline.main: THE BOLIVIAN VIEWPOINT.; Position in the Chaco Held to Be Sustained by Documents.

docs.snippet: NO one was better qualified to be the historian of the Cuban revolution of 1895-98 than Horatio S. Rubens, who acted as general counsel to the junta in New York. A graduate of the College of the City of New York and of the Columbia Law School, he...
docs.lead_paragraph: NO one was better qualified to be the historian of the Cuban revolution of 1895-98 than Horatio S. Rubens, who acted as general counsel to the junta in New York. A graduate of the College of the City of New York and of the Columbia Law School, he entered the office of Elihu Root and became his managing clerk.

headline.main: Cuba's Bitter Struggle to Win Her Independence; An Excellent History Of the Island Republic to the South LIBERTY, THE STORY OF CUBA. By Horatio S. Rubens. Illustrated. New York: Brewer, "Warren & Putnam, Inc. $2.50. Cuba's Struggle for Independence

byline.original: Special Correspondence, THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Aug. 22. -- The number of Americans living abroad increased by over 18,000 last year, according to estimates by the State Department today, based on consular reports. On Jan. 1, 1932, there were 404,317 Americans resident abroad, as...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Aug. 22. -- The number of Americans living abroad increased by over 18,000 last year, according to estimates by the State Department today, based on consular reports. On Jan. 1, 1932, there were 404,317 Americans resident abroad, as compared with 386,272 on Jan. 1, 1931.

headline.main: 404,317 AMERICANS NOW LIVING ABROAD; Number Increased by 18,000 Last Year, State Department Figures Show. 11,276 WENT TO EUROPE Brought Total There to 99,585, With 23,910 in France -- Many Returned From Latin America.

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: The Commerce Department's classified statement on origin and destination of gold imported and exported during July shows that the month's exports went to five different countries, while imports came from thirty separate countries, of which eleven...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Commerce Department's classified statement on origin and destination of gold imported and exported during July shows that the month's exports went to five different countries, while imports came from thirty separate countries, of which eleven sent more than $100,000.
docs.abstract: Rept on exports and imports in July

headline.main: 30 COUNTRIES SENT GOLD TO US IN JULY; Most of the Precious Metal Came From Japan, China and Canada. EXPORT MAINLY TO FRANCE Of $23,473,774 Sent Out, French Drew $21,513,192 From Earmarked Metal.

headline.main: Gold Stocks Up Despite Heavy Earmarking; Most Foreign Exchanges Show Slight Gain

docs.snippet: Speculative Interest seemed to be centered largely in the public utility group on the Stock Exchange yesterday, but substantial advances occurred in other sections of the list. Transactions were the third heaviest of the year for a Saturday, making...
docs.lead_paragraph: Speculative Interest seemed to be centered largely in the public utility group on the Stock Exchange yesterday, but substantial advances occurred in other sections of the list. Transactions were the third heaviest of the year for a Saturday, making up a total of 2,201,000 shares, compared with 661,350 shares on the Saturday before.

headline.main: News, Comment and Incident on the Stock Exchange and in the Financial Markets.
